commitResults.messageTitle: Add .class files to gitignore, add greet echo exit
Add Calendar, Task for Add, List functionality
Add mark, unmark functionality for Level 3
commitResults.messageBody:
To ensure that there is no invalid input, command checks for if the
number is within range of list and if the value input after
"mark/unmark" is an integer value

commitResults.messageTitle: Split tasks into Deadline, Event, Todo for Level-4
Added Exception Handling and readded mark/unmark
Add delete function with exception handling

commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the bulk of the code resided in the main Duke driver class,
and OOP was only employed to model the Calendar and Tasks (Deadline,
Todo, Event).

To better to adhere to OOP principles for this software engineering
project. The code was refactored into different packages. All the code
is in the overarching duke package, and each subpackage aims to serve a
specific function for the program. E.g. duke.info stores all the
information required for the program (Calendar, Tasks, Exceptions) and
the duke.ui package handles the reading and writing from user input.

Let's
* Refactor the code into separate packages for better organization
* Use parent abstract classes to abstract out common functionalities
* Use a Text file to store all standard output messages

Previously, there was a bug where the unmark command did not mark the
job as incomplete, but instead marked the job as complete due to an
erroneous call of markAsDone() instead of markAsNotDone().

This commit changes the method call to properly reflect the action of
marking the task as incomplete.

Let's
* Fix the unmark command to properly carry out the desired functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: Add save functionality when Calendar chanes
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the list of tasks in the Calendar was deleted when the
program exits. This meant that the user would lose all the information
about the tasks after each run of the program.

To make the usage of the program more meaningful, a save functionality
was added that saves the current list of tasks to "tasks.txt" in the
main program folder whenever the task list is updated. This makes the
program more meaningful to use, as there is persistent information that
users can use between each program run.

Let's
* Add a save function to allow users to keep their progress
* Add a load function to automatically load a previous save on startup
* Use a "tasks.txt" file in the main directory to store progress
